title: New 'SNL' cast member Shane Gillis says comedy 'requires risks' after racist comments surface
text:
New “Saturday Night Live” cast member Shane Gillis responded Thursday to backlash over his past use of racist and homophobic slurs, saying that while it wasn’t his intention to hurt anyone, he believes comedians are required to take risks in order to be successful.

“I’m a comedian who pushes boundaries,” he said in a tweeted statement. “I sometimes miss. If you go through my 10 years of comedy, most of it bad, you’re going to find a lot of bad misses.”

Last year, Mr. Gillis reportedly used a racist slur to describe Asian Americans and mocked a Chinese accent on “Matt and Shane’s Secret Podcast.” In a separate podcast, he used a homophobic slur to describe gay men and used other insensitive terms referring to women and the disabled, Variety reported.

Mr. Gillis defended himself in his apology, which was posted just hours after it was announced that he would be joining “SNL.”

“I’m happy to apologize to anyone who’s actually offended by anything I’ve said,” he wrote. “My intention is never to hurt anyone but I am trying to be the best comedian I can be and sometimes that requires risks.”

Mr. Gillis is among three new cast members slated to join “SNL” next season, including Chloe Fineman and Bowen Yang, who is the show’s first Asian-American cast member ever.
